FinTech Web Application (Manual Testing)

Role :

Manual QA Tester

length :

1 Week

Tools & Platforms:

Qase.io

Google Drive

Chrome DevTools

Desktop & Mobile App

overview.

This project documents a structured end-to-end QA cycle performed on a live digital banking platform operating in Nigeria. The objective was to validate high-risk financial workflows including authentication, balance accuracy, and real-money transfers across web and mobile platforms. Testing was conducted using small real transaction amounts to simulate real user behavior and evaluate system reliability in a production-like environment.

ðŸŽ¯ project goals.

  • Validate authentication and session flows

  • Verify balance accuracy before and after transactions

  • Test internal and external money transfers

  • Confirm transaction history accuracy

  • Ensure cross-platform consistency (Web â†” Mobile)

  • Apply risk-based testing strategy

test coverage.

Total Test Cases Designes: 21

Total Test Cases Executed: 17

  • Passed: 17

  • Failed: 0

  • Blocked / Skipped: 0

Tested flows :

  • Authentication / Session management

  • Dashboard & Account Balance

  • Internal Transfers (Real Money)

  • External Transfers (Real Money)

  • Transaction History

  • Cross-Platform Testing: Desktop App & Mobile App

key defects & observations.

Since no functional defects were identified during execution, the focus was placed on system behavior stability and risk validation.

Defect / Observation Type Risk Level Description

Balance updates reflected immediately after transfer

Functional Validation

High (Validated)

Confirms financial accuracy and transaction integrity

Transaction references consistently generated

Data Integrity

High (Validated)

Ensures traceability for dispute resolution

Cross-platform balance synchronization maintained

Consistency

Medium (Validated)

Prevents user confusion across devices

Error messages were clear for invalid transfer attempts

UX / Validation

Low (Positive Observation)

Improves user trust and system transparency

business impact / lessons learned.

  • Registration and input validation findings reinforced the importance of a reliable onboarding flow and clear user feedback.

  • Search relevance defects highlighted how inaccurate results reduce product discoverability and conversion potential.

  • Capturing the checkout session inactivity behavior demonstrated risk awareness beyond simple pass/fail outcomes.

  • Managing defects in Jira and test cases in Qase reflects a structured, industry-aligned QA workflow.
